intro: Encelia procumbens, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a low-growing annual herb with yellow-orange flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has slender, branching stems and narrow, linear leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically 1 to 2 inches in diameter and have five petals. Encelia procumbens is well adapted to dry, sunny environments and is often found in coastal areas and foothills.
